direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods interact with the current iterator and handle state management, making them closely related in terms of behavior.
The hasNext() method is used to determine if there are more elements, which indirectly affects the state management in remove().
Both methods involve updating the current iterator and managing the iteration state, sharing a similar control flow and state management pattern.
The findNext(E) method is used to locate the next element in the iteration, which is indirectly related to the state management in remove().
The findNextByIterator(Iterator<? extends E>) method is used to locate the next element in the iteration, which is indirectly related to the state management in remove().
